displayName: Door of the Sealed Remnants of Judgment

parameters:
Clea: It seems like she's not here. Let's search somewhere
else.
Do you want to investigate the hole?
Clea (Let's prepare first and then do it)
Clea: There's no time... that's a scream, right?
Clea: Let's go all out without holding back!

Researcher Dokusa: I heard the death throes of the monster!
Well done for defeating the monster with the mark of
judgment!
Mage Relm: They were really persistent opponents.
Mage Relm: By the way, do you know about this door?

Mage Relm: Is it something that the Academy, to which I
belong, is hiding? I haven't heard about it...

Researcher Dokusa: I've heard that this place is where the
first Magic Academy was located. It seems that very few
people have actually been here.

Researcher Dokusa: I myself have applied many times, but I
was not approved.

Mage Relm: Well, it doesn't seem to have anything to do with
my dream, so it's fine.

Mage Relm: Anyway, let's go back to the Academy! My dream
will be recognized properly, and my magical power will be
restored!

Thief Nora: R-Relm-san! It's dangerous to run in the desert,
you know~!
Priestess Sophia: Do you really not know anything?

Researcher Dokusa: I won't lie to you. The Archmage called
this place the beginning.
Researcher Dokusa: And also the place of the end.

Researcher Dokusa: As I mentioned earlier, I am
investigating the remains of a dragon. If I make any
interesting discoveries, I will definitely share them with
all of you.
Clea (The place of beginning and end...)

Clea (What kind of beginning and what kind of end is
this...?)

Mage Relm: A sealing magic that has been layered multiple
times... What could possibly be beyond this...?

Mage Relm: I used to think that most of the legends told by
the Terios religion were lies, and that the true heroes were
the most important.

Mage Relm: But they actually existed... and they still exist
to this day.

Mage Relm: The heroes were created by the goddess to defeat
the demons that couldn't be sealed, and even after
everything has ended, they still wander the world without
being released.
Mage Relm: That's such a terrible story, isn't it...

Mage Relm: But that's because there are humans like me...
who become a threat to the world.

Priestess Sophia: There's no need to put everything into
words forcefully.

Priestess Sophia: Besides, it is impossible for us to
understand those who have deviated from the principles of
life with our common sense.

Clea (Just like the Archmage who lost her name only to be
known by her title, there are others who have only their
roles remaining)

Clea (Then, what am I... I have a name, but I don't
understand my true purpose)
Clea (Is this what the Guild Master refers to as a someone?)

Thief Nora: By the way, the sword that the hero has is
amazing!
Thief Nora: With that, it seems like I can do anything!

Priestess Sophia: If it's according to the myth, it's a
sword blessed by the protection of the three goddesses,
bearing the name of the supreme god, Sol.

Priestess Sophia: To be able to cut through everything that
exists in this world...

Clea: The chains of the full moon in the underground of the
Atomis Temple... If we could get some cooperation, we might
be able to cut them.
Do you want to enter the boss area?
Clea (Let's prepare first before doing that)
Archmage: So you've finally made it this far.
Mage Relm: Archmage...! Why are you getting in my way!?

Mage Relm: The Magic Academy conducts various research,
isn't my research also within that scope...?!

Archmage: Let's talk about something from a little while
ago, it's a story from over 50 years ago...

Archmage: The young man had the same dream as you and
entered the academy to create a magic book that seals the
demons created by Subma.

Archmage: The most who gathered materials and conducted
research just like you... although I couldn't obtain the
corpse of a dragon.

Archmage: And foolishly, the young man who met him thought
of summoning a dragon.
Mage Relm: Him... Could it be...!?

Archmage: It was that bard who warned me, telling me not to
become an enemy of the world.

Archmage: The Magic Academy is a dangerous entity beyond
what you can imagine. I don't know what motivates him to
judge and target others.

Archmage: The remnants of this judgment are proof of that...
The old Magic Academy was annihilated in an instant by him,
along with the entire city.

Archmage: This place, where I have come to know the truth of
everything, is both the beginning and the end for me.

Archmage: Since the day the old Academy disappeared, it has
been the role of the Archmage to put an end to research that
the bard considers dangerous.
Archmage: You can still turn back.
Archmage: This is the end of your dream.

Mage Relm: This isn't the end! I haven't... I haven't
accepted anything yet!
Archmage: Are you all also involved?

Clea: I may not understand complicated things, but I intend
to stay with Relm until she is satisfied.

Thief Nora: Ah, me too! Since you've helped me a lot, I'll
return the favor.

Priestess Sophia: I think Relm-chan is stubborn, so she
won't be satisfied unless she goes deeper into it.

Archmage: There is a tradition where the Archmages of the
past are given names based on their achievements after their
death.
Archmage: In my case, I will probably be called like this--

Archmage: I can't compete with your age... No, it's probably
because you all have become too strong...

Archmage: I won't do anything to stop you anymore, but I
have one request.

Archmage: If you determine that her dream is dangerous, I
want you all to stop her...

Archmage: We must never let Kanonas... No, the Empire may be
destroyed... Please, I beg you.
